text: William Woodward "Hootie" Johnson (February 16, 1931 â€“ July 14, 2017) was an American banker and the chairman of the executive committee at Bank of America. He was a member of the South Carolina Business Hall of Fame and a chairman of Augusta National Golf Club. He was born in Augusta, Georgia. From 1957 through 1958, Johnson served in the South Carolina House of Representatives. He was a member of the Republican Party. Johnson died on July 14, 2017 of mesothelioma in Columbia, South Carolina at the age of 86.Ex- Masters Chairman, USC Grad Hootie Johnson Dies ==References== ==Other websites== * Biography of Hootie Johnson Category:1931 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Deaths from mesothelioma Category:Cancer deaths in South Carolina Category:American philanthropists Category:Businesspeople from Georgia (U.S. state) Category:Politicians from Georgia (U.S. state) Category:Politicians from South Carolina Category:Businesspeople from South Carolina Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians
title: William "Hootie" Johnson
